column4: I have just done the injternet upgrade of ubuntu 8.04 to 8.10. Everything went fine until the reboot. My machine has hung, last message was *Running local boot scripts (/etc/rc.local)    [OK] when i ctrl alt del i get a msg saying "Stopping gnome display manager" then a few momnents and quick ubuntu splash screen flashes up and reboot......
it could be your X window crashing, i've encountered the same problem before.
should i start looking in the xorg.conf?
i have no clue. I got the X window crash in Red Hat and Mandrake. Ubuntu did once or twice on me too. it was usually after a fresh install, so I just reinstalled it
